required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on August 12, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma for Mechanically Ventilated Population
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single Arm, Phase 1, Safety and Exploratory Efficacy Study of Convalescent Plasma for Severely Ill Mechanically Ventilated Participants With COVID-19 Caused by SARS-CoV-2

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if this plasma can be safely used in humans with COVID-19 and to see if it can improve patients' health when they are sick with COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: This open-label, single arm, phase 1 trial will assess the safety and efficacy of convalescent plasma in severely ill, mechanically ventilated participants with pneumonia due to COVID-19. This study will enroll adults 18 years old and older, including pregnant women. A total of 50 eligible participants will receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19. Participants will receive convalescent plasma on Study Day 1 in addition to standard of care. Participants will be assessed daily while hospitalized and then on Study Days 15, 22, 29, and 60. All participants will undergo a series of safety, efficacy, and laboratory assessments. Blood samples will be collected on Days 1 (prior to plasma administration), 3, 5, 8, 11, 15, 29, and 60. Oropharyngeal or endotracheal samples will be collected on Days 1 (prior to plasma administration), 3, 5, 8, 11, and 15.

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of participants with at least one serious adverse events (SAEs) at Study Day 29.
Time to removal from mechanical ventilation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status Assessment, Using 8-point Ordinal Scale, of Convalescent Plasma Administration
Clinical Status Assessment Using the National Early Warning Score (NEWS) of Convalescent Plasma Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Time to discharge or to a NEWS of â‰¤ 2 and maintained for 24 hours, whichever occurs first. NEWS assessed daily while hospitalized until discharge or death and on Days 15 and 29. Higher NEWS is worse, range from 0 to 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of New Oxygenation Use up to Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of new oxygenation use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of New Oxygen Use up to Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Days of new oxygen use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygenation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while hospitalized up to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of supplemental oxygen while in hospital up to Study Day 29. In hospital supplemental oxygen days counted as days with a WHO8 ordinal score of 5, 6, or 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen Days up to Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of non-invasive ventilation/high flow oxygen while in hospital up to Day 29, defined as having WHO8 ordinal score of 6 = Hospitalized, on non-invasive ventilation or high flow oxygen devices

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With at Least One Day of Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen up to Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least one day of non-invasive ventilation (WHO8 ordinal score of 6) while in hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen up to Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of non-invasive ventilation/high flow oxygen up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Invasive Ventilation/ Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation(ECMO) Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Days on Invasive Ventilator/ECMO defined as WHO8 ordinal score of 7 = Hospitalized, on invasive mechanical ventilation or ECMO

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of New Mechanical Ventilation or ECMO Use of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of new mechanical ventilation or ECMO use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of New Mechanical Ventilation or ECMO Use of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of new mechanical ventilation or ECMO use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Duration (days) of first hospitalization. Time until death or discharge or Study Day 29

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality
secondary_outcome.description: 28 day mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) Through Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: subjects with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) through Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With at Least One Grade 3 and Grade 4 Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Events Through Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least one Grade 3 or Grade 4 clinical and/or laboratory adverse events through Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in WBC With Differential Through Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

intervention.description: Participants will receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult â‰¥18 years of age
2. Laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection as determined by PCR or other authorized or approved assay in any specimen collected within 72 hours prior to enrollment. Note - An exception must be requested to the Sponsor ifâ‰¥72 hours since positive test.
3. Hospitalized, on invasive mechanical ventilation or ECMO, consistent with a clinical status assessment 8-point ordinal scale severity score of 7.
4. Documentation of pneumonia with radiographic evidence of infiltrates by imaging (e.g., chest x-ray or CT scan).
5. Patient or proxy is willing and able to provide written informed consent and comply with all protocol requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindication to transfusion (e.g., severe volume overload, history of severe allergic reaction to blood products), as judged by the investigator.
2. Clinical suspicion that the etiology of acute illness (acute decompensation) is primarily due to a condition other than COVID-19
3. Receipt of other investigational therapy as a part of another clinical trial. a. Note: investigational therapies used as part of clinical care, (eg, remdesivir, hydroxychloroquine) are permissible.

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania

outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). group.title: Treatment
group.description: Penn COVID-19 convalescent plasma COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma: Participants will receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19.

measure.title: Changes in AST Measurement Through Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
measure.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
measure.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects.

outcome.title: Changes in PT Measurement Through Day 29 of Convalescent Plasma Administration.
outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
outcome.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects. analyzed sample size is 30 because 2 subjects did not have PT lab collected.

group.title: Treatment
group.description: Penn COVID-19 convalescent plasma COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma: Participants will receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 65 days after receiving investigational product

group.title: Treatment

event.description: Life-threatening arrhythmia OR Urgent intervention indicated
Cerebral vascular accident (e.g., stroke with neurological deficit)
Life-threatening embolic event (e.g., pulmonary embolism, thrombus)

event.sub_title: Hemoglobin, Low (g/dL; mmol/L) >= 13 years of age (female only)
Hemoglobin, Low (g/dL; mmol/L) >= 13 years of age (male only)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
